Re-igniting this: Replace content settings favicon picker with basic manifest file generator. Remember forum votes are visible longer than just slack votes so do both if you like the idea.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Replace-the-single-favicon-option-in-content-settings-with-basic/idi-p/263209#M32397>
minor - the font loaded by the community forums is loading via http, change to https to prevent security warnings
do you just put the json output in there instead? or link to the mainifest.json file?
so- yes it does replace the link favicon. however I usually still include 1 favicon size in my `<head>` for backward compatibility sake.
and you link out to the manifest.json, you don’t put the actual manifest in your head, just the link to it.

Ah ok so is it like this:
```
<link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/png" href="/manifest.json"/>
```
just asking cause this seems way easier than how i do with with links and metas for colors and what not

You’re close but not quite there.
more like
`<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.json">`
<https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/web-app-manifest/>

I plan to write up a post on creating an extremely basic PWA on HS (it’s possible to truly do one now.) It’ll be a little bit though, the service worker bit is the hard part. Manifest is easy, and yes it’s perfectly fine to just have a manifest file, not every site necessitates a service worker
#Following let me know when you write it up, would love to read that
